member.name: T:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.DataEncodation.ECISet.ECICodewordsLength
member.summary: Length indicator for number of ECI codewords
member.remarks: ISO/IEC 18004:2006 Chapter 6.4.2 Page 24. 1 codeword length = 0. Any additional codeword add 1 to front. Eg: 3 = 110
member.description: Bits required for each one is: one = 1, two = 2, three = 3

member.name: T:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.DataEncodation.EightBitByteEncoder
member.summary: EightBitByte is a bit complicate compare to other encoding. It can accept several different encoding table from global ECI table. For different country, default encoding is different. JP use shift_jis, International spec use iso-8859-1 China use ASCII which is first part of normal char table. Between 00 to 7E Korean and Thai should have their own default encoding as well. But so far I can not find their specification freely online. QrCode.Net will use international standard which is iso-8859-1 as default encoding. And use UTF8 as suboption for any string that not belong to any char table or other encoder.

member.name: F:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.DataEncodation.EightBitByteEncoder.EIGHT_BIT_BYTE_BITCOUNT
member.summary: Bitcount, Chapter 8.4.4, P.24

member.name: M:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.DataEncodation.EightBitByteEncoder.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: EightBitByte encoder's encoding will change according to different region

member.name: M:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.Terminate.Terminator.TerminateBites(Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.BitList,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will create BitList that contain terminator, padding and pad codewords for given datacodewords. Use it to full fill the data codewords capacity. Thus avoid massive empty bits.
member.remarks: ISO/IEC 18004:2006 P. 32 33. Terminator / Bit stream to codeword conversion
member.param: Method will add terminator bits at end of baseList
Num of bits for datacodewords without terminator
Total number of datacodewords for specific version. Receive it under Version/VersionTable
member.returns: Bitlist that contain Terminator, padding and padcodewords

member.summary: Use number of data bits(header + eci header + data bits from EncoderBase) to search for proper version to use between min and max boundary. Boundary define by DynamicSearchIndicator method.

member.name: M:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.Versions.VersionTable.initialize
member.summary: We only need totalCodeWords, dataCodewords and number of blocks. Other variable can be calculate through equation by given that three variables. This table try to use original table layout for easier error detection.
member.remarks: ISO/IEC 18004/2006 Tabler 9 Page 38 Only include non-micro QRCode

member.name: M:Gma.QrCodeNet.Encoding.Windows.Render.ColorContrast.GetContrast(System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Calculate background and fronntcolor's contrast ratio. To assist dark module and light module's choose. Higher ratio means easier to decode by decoder. Black and White will have highest ratio = 21.
member.returns: Contrast object.
